page.title: 04BOUNDARY FARM. CROPS
page.content: special problems and the sides of the ditches have been lined with wooden boards to stop the banks crumbling. The water is let off the land by plastic pipes which enter the ditches via wooden shutes again to stop the removal of soil from the ditch side. CROPS. The cash crops grown are Leeks, Potatoes, Cabbages and Barley. The other crops are fodder crops to feed the animals. The pasture can be found close to the farm buildings so the cows don't have far to walk at milking time.Longer distances waste time and reduce milk yield. A lot of time is spent where leeks and cabbages are grown because they're labour intensive and need harvesting by hand. The other crops are capital intensive and take up less time because machinery is used throughout the time from planting to harvesting.
